sections.heading: Short title. This Act may be cited as the Health Access Network Act.
sections.text: Short title. This Act may be cited as the Health Access Network Act.

sections.heading: Purpose. The purpose of this Act is to provide aid to existing primary health care safety nets for specialty care that will allow the development of a comprehensive system of health care services
sections.text: Purpose. The purpose of this Act is to provide aid to existing primary health care safety nets for specialty care that will allow the development of a comprehensive system of health care services.

sections.heading: Definition. In this Act, "Department" means the Department of Public Health.
sections.text: Definition. In this Act, "Department" means the Department of Public Health.

sections.heading: Pilot program. The Department shall establish a Health Access Network pilot program in Kane County
sections.text: The program shall provide funding for and coordination of health care services that include comprehensive case management and ancillary services to support treatment goals. In particular, the program

sections.heading: Report. The Department, in cooperation with the lead agency designated under Section 20, shall submit a report on the operation of the pilot program to the General Assembly after the pilot program has been in operation for 18 months
sections.text: The report shall include the Department's recommendations concerni

sections.heading: Implementation subject to appropriations. Implementation of this Act is subject to appropriations made to the Department for that purpose.
sections.text: Implementation subject to appropriations. Implementation of this Act is subject to appropriations made to the Department for that purpose.

sections.heading: Effective date. This Act takes effect upon becoming law.
sections.text: Effective date. This Act takes effect upon becoming law.
